questions.question: The use of what AWS feature or service allows companies to track and categorize spending on a detailed level?
questions.explanation: Cost allocation tags allow companies to label AWS resources and track, group, and report AWS costs by project, department, or environment.

questions.question: Which service stores objects, provides real-time access to those objects, and offers versioning and lifecycle capabilities?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is an object storage service that provides real-time access to data, along with versioning and lifecycle management for stored objects.

questions.question: What AWS team assists customers with accelerating cloud adoption through paid engagements in any of several specialty practice area ?
questions.explanation: AWS Professional Services provides paid consulting and hands-on help to accelerate cloud adoption and help customers design and implement AWS solutions.

questions.question:
A customer would like to design and build a new workload on AWS Cloud but does not have the AWS-related software technical expertise in-house.
Which of the following AWS programs can a customer take advantage of to achieve that outcome?
questions.explanation: AWS Partner Network Consulting Partners are third-party companies that help customers design, build, and migrate workloads to AWS when they lack in-house expertise.

questions.question: Distributing workloads across multiple Availability Zones supports which cloud architecture design principle?
questions.explanation: Distributing workloads across multiple Availability Zones follows the design for failure principle, ensuring the application continues to run even if one zone fails.

questions.question: Which AWS services can host a Microsoft SQL Server database? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 allows you to install and manage SQL Server directly, and Amazon RDS for SQL Server provides a managed SQL Server database. Aurora and Redshift do not support SQL Server.

questions.question: Which of the following inspects AWS environments to find opportunities that can save money for users and also improve system performance ?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor analyzes your AWS environment and provides recommendations to improve cost optimization, performance, security, and fault tolerance.

questions.question: Which of the following Amazon EC2 pricing models allow customers to use existing server-bound software license ?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Hosts allow customers to use existing server-bound licenses by giving them physical control over the underlying EC2 host.

questions.question: Which AWS characteristics make AWS cost effective for a workload with dynamic user demand? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows scaling based on demand, and pay-as-you-go pricing ensures you only pay for what you use, making AWS cost-effective for dynamic workloads.

questions.question: Which service enables risk auditing by continuously monitoring and logging account activity, including user actions in the AWS Management Console and AWS SDKs?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records API calls and user activity across AWS, making it ideal for security auditing and tracking who did what in an account.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of Amazon S3? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is an object storage service and is highly durable, storing data redundantly across multiple devices and facilities.

questions.question: Which services can be used across hybrid AWS Cloud architectures? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 provides DNS for hybrid environments, and a Virtual Private Gateway connects on-premises networks securely to AWS.

questions.question: What costs are included when comparing AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) with on-premises TCO?
questions.explanation: AWS TCO includes costs such as data center security, which are part of running on-premises infrastructure but handled by AWS in the cloud.

questions.question:
A company is considering using AWS for a self-hosted database that requires a nightly shutdown for maintenance and cost-saving purposes.
Which service should the company use?

options.text: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) with Amazon EC2 instance store
Amazon EC2 with Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)

questions.explanation: Using EC2 with EBS allows instances to be stopped and restarted while preserving data, making it ideal for databases that need nightly shutdowns.

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct relationship between regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations?
questions.explanation: A Region is a geographic area that contains multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: Which AWS tools assist with estimating costs? (Select three.)

options.text: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

questions.explanation: Cost allocation tags, the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator, and the AWS TCO Calculator help estimate and forecast AWS costs.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of AWS consolidated billing? (Select TWO.)

options.text: The ability to receive one bill for multiple accounts
Service limits increasing by default in all accounts
A fixed discount on the monthly bill
Potential volume discounts, as usage in all accounts is combined
The automatic extension of the master account's AWS support plan to all accounts

questions.explanation: Consolidated billing provides one bill for multiple accounts and allows combined usage to qualify for volume discounts.

questions.question: Which of the following Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models provides the highest average savings compared to On-Demand pricing?

options.text: One-year, No Upfront, Standard RI pricing
One-year, All Upfront, Convertible RI pricing
Three-year, All Upfront, Standard RI pricing
Three-year, No Upfront, Convertible RI pricing

questions.explanation: Three-year, All Upfront, Standard Reserved Instances provide the highest savings compared to On-Demand pricing.

questions.question: Compared with costs in traditional and virtualized data centers, AWS has:

options.text: greater variable costs and greater upfront costs.
fixed usage costs and lower upfront costs.
lower variable costs and greater upfront costs.
lower variable costs and lower upfront costs.

questions.explanation: AWS has lower variable costs and lower upfront costs because customers only pay for what they use and do not buy hardware.

questions.question: A characteristic of edge locations is that they:

options.text: host Amazon EC2 instances closer to users.
help lower latency and improve performance for users.
cache frequently changing data without reaching the origin server.

questions.explanation: Edge locations improve performance by reducing latency, serving content closer to end users.

questions.question: Which of the following can limit Amazon Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket access to specific users?

options.text: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies

questions.explanation: IAM policies control which users or roles can access specific Amazon S3 buckets and objects.

questions.question: Which of the following security-related actions are available at no cost?

options.text: Contacting AWS Professional Services to request a workshop
Attending AWS classes at a local university

questions.explanation: AWS provides forums, blogs, documentation, and whitepapers for free to help customers learn and troubleshoot.

questions.question: Which of the Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models can change the attributes of the RI as long as the exchange results in the creation of RIs of equal or greater value?
questions.explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances allow customers to change instance attributes as long as the new reservation has equal or greater value.

questions.question: Which AWS feature will reduce the customer's total cost of ownership (TCO)?
questions.explanation: Elastic computing reduces TCO by scaling resources up and down based on demand, avoiding over-provisioning.

questions.question: Which of the following services will automatically scale with an expected increase in web traffic?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes traffic and scales to handle increases in web traffic.

questions.question: Where are AWS compliance documents, such as an SOC 1 report, located?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides access to compliance and audit reports such as SOC 1.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following activities are the customer's responsibility? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Patching operating system components for Amazon Relational Database Server (Amazon RDS)
Maintaining environmental controls within a data center

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting their own data and configuring network ACLs under the shared responsibility model.

questions.question: Which is a recommended pattern for designing a highly available architecture on AWS?

options.text: Ensure that components have low-latency network connectivity.
Run enough Amazon EC2 instances to operate at peak load.
Ensure that the application is designed to accommodate failure of any single component.
Use a monolithic application that handles all operations.

questions.explanation: Highly available architectures are designed so that no single component failure can bring down the entire system.

questions.question: According to best practices, how should an application be designed to run in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Applications should be loosely coupled so components can scale and fail independently.

questions.question: AWS supports which of the following methods to add security to Identity and Access Management (IAM) users? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS supports Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and strong password policies to secure IAM users.

questions.question: Which AWS services should be used for read/write of constantly changing data? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS and Amazon EFS support frequent read/write operations for constantly changing data.

questions.question: What is one of the advantages of the Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?

options.text: It simplifies relational database administration tasks.
It automatically scales databases for loads.
It enabled users to dynamically adjust CPU and RAM resources.

questions.explanation: Amazon RDS reduces administrative overhead by handling backups, patching, and maintenance automatically.

questions.question:
A customer needs to run a MySQL database that easily scales.
Which AWS service should they use?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL-compatible relational database designed for high performance and easy scaling.

questions.question: Which of the following components of the AWS Global Infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers interconnected through low latency links?
questions.explanation: An Availability Zone consists of one or more data centers connected by low-latency, high-speed networks.

questions.question: Which of the following is a shared control between the customer and AWS?

options.text: Providing a key for Amazon S3 client-side encryption
Configuration of an Amazon EC2 instance
Environmental controls of physical AWS data centers

questions.explanation: Awareness and training are shared responsibilities between AWS and the customer.

questions.question: How many Availability Zones should compute resources be provisioned across to achieve high availability?

options.text: A minimum of four or more

questions.explanation: High availability requires running resources in at least two Availability Zones.

questions.question: One of the advantages to moving infrastructure from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud is:

options.text: it allows the business to eliminate IT bills.
it allows the business to put a server in each customer's data center.
it allows the business to focus on business activities.
it allows the business to leave servers unpatched.

questions.explanation: AWS lets companies focus on their business instead of managing and maintaining physical infrastructure.

questions.question: What is the lowest-cost, durable storage option for retaining database backups for immediate retrieval?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is low-cost, highly durable storage that allows immediate retrieval of backups.

questions.question: Which AWS IAM feature allows developers to access AWS services through the AWS CLI?
questions.explanation: Access keys allow IAM users to authenticate and use AWS through the CLI and SDKs.

questions.question: Which of the following is a fast and reliable NoSQL database service?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fast, fully managed NoSQL database service.

questions.question: What is an example of agility in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Using Consolidated Billing to produce one bill
Decreased acquisition time for new compute resources

questions.explanation: Agility means quickly obtaining new compute resources, which AWS enables.

questions.question: Which service should a customer use to consolidate and centrally manage multiple AWS accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows centralized management and billing of multiple AWS accounts.

questions.question: What approach to transcoding a large number of individual video files adheres to AWS architecture principles?

options.text: Using a single large instance during off-peak hours
Using a large GPU instance type

questions.explanation: Using many instances in parallel follows AWS best practices for scalability and resilience.

questions.question: For which auditing process does AWS have sole responsibility?
questions.explanation: AWS is solely responsible for physical security of its data centers.

questions.question: Which feature of the AWS Cloud will support an international company's requirement for low latency to all of its customers?
questions.explanation: Global reach allows AWS to serve users worldwide with low latency.

questions.question: Which of the following is the customer's responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: Customers must patch and manage their EC2 instances, while AWS manages the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question:
A customer is using multiple AWS accounts with separate billing.
How can the customer take advantage of volume discounts with minimal impact to the AWS resources?

options.text: Create one global AWS account and move all AWS resources to that account.
Sign up for three years of Reserved Instance pricing up front.
Use the consolidated billing feature from AWS Organizations.
Sign up for the AWS Enterprise support plan to get volume discounts.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations consolidated billing combines usage across accounts to qualify for volume discounts.

questions.question: Which of the following are features of Amazon CloudWatch Logs? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Summaries by Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)

questions.explanation: CloudWatch Logs supports real-time monitoring and configurable log retention.

questions.question: Which of the following is an AWS managed Domain Name System (DNS) web service?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is AWSâ€™s managed DNS service.

questions.question:
A customer is deploying a new application and needs to choose an AWS Region.
Which of the following factors could influence the customer's decision? (Select TWO.)

options.text: The application's presentation in the local language
Proximity to the customer's office for on-site visits

questions.explanation: Customers choose a Region based on low latency to users and data sovereignty or compliance requirements.
